hc.server.ui

Class ProjectContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • hc.server.ui.ProjectContext

  • public class ProjectContext
extends Object
    There is one ProjectContext instance for each HAR Project at runtime.

    a ProjectContext instance will be created before EVENT_SYS_PROJ_STARTUP, and will be released after EVENT_SYS_PROJ_SHUTDOWN.
    reloading HAR projects (NOT restart server), new instance of ProjectContext will be created.

    it is easy to get instance of ProjectContext from everywhere, for examples :
    1. getProjectContext() by static method,
    2. Mlet.getProjectContext(),
    3. Assistant.getProjectContext(),
    4. CtrlResponse.getProjectContext(),
    5. Robot.getProjectContext(),
    6. Converter.getProjectContext(),
    7. Device.getProjectContext(),
    Since:
    7.0

      boolean isMobileInBackground()
      in session level, true means mobile is keep connecting and run in background;
      in project level, true means at least one client session is run in background.

      Important :
      background mode may be NOT supported by mobile.
      boolean isMobileLineOn()
      in session level, true means mobile is line on.
      in project level, true means one or more mobiles are online.
      boolean isMobileOnRelay()
      in session level, true means mobile is on relay server (not directly connect to your server);
      in project level, true means at least one client session is on relay.

      void sendMessage(String caption, String text, int type)
      it is equals with sendMessage(String, String, int, BufferedImage, int).

      in session level, send a alert message to mobile.
      in project level, send the same alert to all client sessions.

      Note : if mobile is in background (isMobileInBackground()), a notification is also created for mobile.

      if mobile option [Message, Notification to Speech also] is on, it may be spoken.
      the speech or not is depends on text, TTS engine, locale and mute of mobile.
      boolean sendMessage(String caption, String text, int type, BufferedImage image, int timeOut)
      send an alert message to current mobile if in session level, or send the same alert to all client sessions if in project level.
      void sendMovingMsg(String msg)
      send a message moving from right to left for current mobile if in session level, or send same message to all client sessions if in project level.

      Note : if mobile is in background (isMobileInBackground()), a notification is also created for mobile.

      if mobile option [Message, Notification to Speech also] is on, it may be spoken.
      the speech or not is depends on text, TTS engine, locale and mute of mobile.
      void sendNotification(String title, String text, int flags)
      send notification to current mobile if in session level, or send notification to all client session if in project level.
      void sendQuestion(String caption, String text, BufferedImage image, Runnable yesRunnable, Runnable noRunnable, Runnable cancelRunnable)
      send a question to mobile if in session level, or send same question to all client sessions if in project level.
      boolean sendQuestionAndWait(String caption, String text, BufferedImage image, Runnable yesRunnable, Runnable noRunnable, Runnable cancelRunnable)
      for more, see sendQuestion(String, String, BufferedImage, Runnable, Runnable, Runnable)

      About return status :
      1.
      boolean sendQuestionAndWaitNotCancelable(String caption, String text, BufferedImage image, Runnable yesRunnable, Runnable noRunnable)
      see sendQuestion(String, String, BufferedImage, Runnable, Runnable, Runnable) for more.
      void sendQuestionNotCancelable(String caption, String text, BufferedImage image, Runnable yesRunnable, Runnable noRunnable)
      send a not cancelable question to mobile if in session level, or send same question to all client sessions if in project level.
      void sendVoice(String voice)
      send a voice to client/mobile if in session level, or send same voice to all client sessions if in project level.

      if you want show this voice as a moving message and speech again, please use sendMovingMsg(String).

        public static final String EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_BACKGROUND_OR_FOREGROUND
        this event will be triggered when mobile enter pause (background) or resume.
        invoke isMobileInBackground() to check whether is background (onPause) or not (onResume).

        Note :
        1. server will trigger this event (isMobileInBackground() returns false) after EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOGIN.

    • Method Detail

      • actionKeys

        public final void actionKeys(String keys)
        action keyboard keys on server. For example "Control+Shift+Escape", "Shift+a" (for input 'A'), "B" (for input 'b').

        more key string , please refer http ://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/awt/event/KeyEvent.html

        NOTE : NOT all keys are supported. (META is Max OS X Command)

        If a HAR package developed in J2SE, and run in Android platform, it does as following:
        1. the key name is searched first in java.awt.event.KeyEvent ('VK_' is NOT required. 'VK_' is prefix in J2SE),
        2. convert keyCode in J2SE to Android (e.g. java.awt.event.KeyEvent.VK_BACK_SPACE => android.view.KeyEvent.KEYCODE_DEL).
        3. if your HAR package is designed for Android only, for example, Shift+KEYCODE_a (for input 'A', 'KEYCODE_' is required prefix for Android).
        4. more Android keys, please refer http://developer.android.com/reference/android/view/KeyEvent.html
        5. in J2SE, keys begin with 'VK_'; in Android, keys begin with 'KEYCODE_'.
        Parameters:
        keys - for example, "Control+Shift+Escape" or "Tab" (case insensitive)
        Since:
        7.0

      • addMenuItem

        public final void addMenuItem(MenuItem item)
        add a mobile/client menu item for project or session at run-time.

        if in project level, add item to list of project level.
        if in session level, add item to list of session level.

        a menu presented on the mobile client is composed of menu items of project level (priority) and session level.
        the menu items of session level will gone after line-off / logout.

        Important :
        the scripts of menu item works in session level, no matter which is added to list of project level or session level.

        it is thread safe.
        Parameters:
        item - the MenuItem to add
        Since:
        7.20
        See Also:
        insertMenuItem(MenuItem), addMenuItemToProjectLevel(MenuItem, int), addMenuItemToSessionLevel(MenuItem, int), isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()

      • addSystemEventListener

        public final void addSystemEventListener(SystemEventListener listener)
        add the specified system event listener.

        If current thread is for session, then the listener is added in session level, otherwise it is project level.
        the listener in session level will gone automatically after EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOGOUT.

        the procedure of SystemEventListener.onEvent(String) is in session level if triggered by session events (for example EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOGIN), even if it is added in project level.

        these following events may be listened:
        • EVENT_SYS_PROJ_STARTUP,
        • EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOGIN,
        • EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_BACKGROUND_OR_FOREGROUND,
        • EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOGOUT,
        • EVENT_SYS_PROJ_SHUTDOWN,
        • or other events in the future.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be added.
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        removeSystemEventListener(SystemEventListener), isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()

        set alert on for mobile if in session level, or set alert on to all client sessions if in project level.

        when alert on, mobile will keep vibrate and play a tone.

      • backup

        public final void backup()
        backup user properties and private files of current project.

        usually this method is not used,
        because the server will automatically backup regularly, only when the following conditions are meet :
        1. some data saved local, and some stored on cloud, if power off occurs, the status saved recently will gone, but the cloud not gone.
        2. if this method is invoked, when power off occurs, server will restore all at the next startup.

        Know More :
        1. DB is not required to close before backup.
        2. private file which is opening or writing is not required to close before backup.
        3. backup will not work on Windows because of exclusive lock.
        4. backup works well on Linux, macOS, Android.
        5. return normally means backup successfully.

      • eval

        public final Object eval(String shell)
        run a shell of JRuby script, and return a object if with return command.

        for example, a scripts with four lines, ('\n' is required for each line at end) :

        t = 100
        i = 2 + t
        puts i
        return i # 102
        it is recommended that set variable in setAttribute(String, Object) for project level and ClientSession.setAttribute(String, Object) for session level rather than set global variable (begin with $) in JRuby scripts.

        the above script is safe even if multiple threads calling, because they are all local variable (TRANSIENT).

        CAUTION :
        variable (if it is NOT local variable) set by one thread will be visible to another thread. 
         import Java::hc.server.util.JavaLangSystemAgent
 
  @callMS = JavaLangSystemAgent.currentTimeMillis().to_s()
 sleep(10)
 puts "callMS : " +  @callMS
        if thread B call it after thread A one second, then print out the same value.
        Parameters:
        shell - the evaluate shell scripts.
        Returns:
        a object if with return command.
        Since:
        7.0

      • getDBConnection

        public final Connection getDBConnection(String dbName,
                                        String username,
                                        String password)
        to create or open exists database.

        the database is stored in directory {HC_Home}/user_data/{projectID}/_HC/DB/{dbName}, for more see getPrivateFile(String)

        Note :
        1. SQLXML is NOT supported.
        2. the default WRITE DELAY property of database is true, which is 500 milliseconds. To change it see SET FILES WRITE DELAY.
        3. be careful the exception of deadlock when in multiple threads.

        the latest build-in database server is HSQLDB 2.3.4, user guide is here.
        Parameters:
        dbName -
        username -
        password -
        Returns:
        null means database error occurs.
        Since:
        7.50
        See Also:
        closeDB(Connection), removeDB(String), backup()

      • getLoginID

        public final String getLoginID()
        return the login ID/Email, which is NOT verified by HomeCenter.MOBI possibly.

        Important :
        user maybe change ID according to their own wishes, project will restart and new instance of ProjectContext will be created if the login ID/Email is changed.

        do follow steps to check the login Email account is verified by HomeCenter.MOBI or not:
        1. get login ID/Email by getLoginID()
        2. get token for check by getTokenForCheck()
        3. if user donate or buy some service, the token will be changed!
        4. submit URL : "https://homecenter.mobi/ajax/call.php?f=checkEmail&email=%X%X&token=XX"
        5. email should be encoded by java.net.URLEncoder.encode("email@company.com","UTF-8")
        6. token is NOT required to encode.
        7. if successful then return "verified"; if not , then return "failed".
        8. there is not method do above, because this is open source server.

        Note :
        1. if the verification is very important to your business, you should ensure the https is NOT under Man-in-the-middle attack.
        2. user is NOT allowed to setup multiple servers with same login account, only one server is verified at same time.
        Returns:
        login ID/Email on this server
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        getMemberID(), getApplicationServerID()

      • getMemberID

        public final String getMemberID()
        MemberID is used to distinguish between different members of a family or group, which belongs to same LoginID.

        Know more :
        1. MemberID is stored in client.
        2. if MemberID is not set, a dialog for input member ID is showed on client, and current thread is block until return MemberID or line off.
        3. this method is synchronized for multiple projects.
        4. the MemberID dialog can not be canceled (for example back key in Android).
        5. user maybe set same MemberID in multiple mobile at same time.
        6. if same MemberID connected at same time, then a warning message is send to each client.
        7. to set/change MemberID before login, click "Option" button at client login form.
        8. it is available in EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOGIN.
        Returns:
        empty string if line off, not login or not in session level.
        Since:
        7.74
        See Also:
        getLoginID(), getSoftUID(), isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()

      • getMenuItemBy

        public final MenuItem getMenuItemBy(String scheme,
                                    String elementID)
        for example, to get menu item "cmd://myCommand",
        the scheme is "MenuItem.CMD_SCHEME", and element ID is "myCommand",

        if in project level, search item from list of project level.
        if in session level, search item from total list of project level and session level.

        it is thread safe.
        Parameters:
        scheme - one of MenuItem.CMD_SCHEME, MenuItem.CONTROLLER_SCHEME, MenuItem.FORM_SCHEME, MenuItem.SCREEN_SCHEME.
        elementID -
        Returns:
        null means not found.
        Since:
        7.20
        See Also:
        isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()

      • getMobileDPI

        for Android client, it means densityDpi;

      • getMobileLocale

        public final String getMobileLocale()
        three format locales :
        1. language ("en", "fr", "ro", "ru", etc.)
        2. language-region ("en-US", "es-419", "zh-CN", etc.)
        3. language-region ("zh-Hans-CN", "zh-Hant-CN", etc.)

        Important :
        in Chinese mainland, it normally returns "zh-Hans-CN" for iPhone, and "zh-CN" for Android client.

        Know more :
        1. to find the best match from an I18N map, see matchLocale(String, Map).
        2. user maybe change client language and country/region.
        3. to check a locale is RTL (Right To Left) or not, see isRTL(String).
        4. for RTL layout, see Mlet.enableApplyOrientationWhenRTL(boolean).
        5. to set RTL or not for HTML DIV and its sub elements, see HTMLMlet.setRTL(javax.swing.JComponent, boolean)
        Returns:
        in session level, return mobile locale;
        in project level, returns the locale for all sessions or 'en-US'.
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        matchLocale(String, Map), isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()

      • getPrivateFile

        public final File getPrivateFile(String fileName)
        for example :
        1. getPrivateFile("testFile");
        2. getPrivateFile("mySubDir").mkdir();
        3. getPrivateFile("mySubDir2/subSubDir").mkdirs();//it works on Windows, Linux and Mac
        4. getPrivateFile("mySubDir/testFile");
        5. getPrivateFile("mySubDir2/subSubDir/testFile");
        6. new File(getPrivateFile("mySubDir"), "testFile");
        7. new File(getPrivateFile("mySubDir2/subSubDir"), "testFile");

        Tip :
        if parent directory of result is not exists, then it will be created before return.

        private file VS DB connection :
        When project runs in Home environment, please pay more attention about power off, it may be caused by children, no wait to shutdown. If private file is frequently written, using DB connection is a better choice, because it appends data to log at the tail of file and DB manager will fix error that abnormal shutdown. All-In-RAM DB never write file to disk.

        More about private file :
        1. the file is allowed full access and NOT limited by HomeCenter security manager, and it is also protected from being read or written by other HAR projects.
        2. the File fileName is read/written in directory {HC_Home}/user_data/{projectID}/{fileName}.
        3. sub directory "{projectID}/_HC/" is reservered by server, see getDBConnection(String, String, String),
        4. if current project is deleted, all private files of current project will be deleted.
        5. to save small data, please invoke saveProperties().
        6. if the data is important, please encrypt data or stored separately.
        7. if this server runs on Android Marshmallow or later, Android will do "Auto Backup for Apps".
        Parameters:
        fileName -
        Returns:
        the private file fileName.
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        createTempFile(String), saveProperties(), getDBConnection(String, String, String)

      • getRobot

        public final Robot getRobot(String name)
        get the wrapper of robot by name.

        Important :
        it is a wrapper of robot, not the instance created by your scripts.
        it means that your methods not extend from Robot will NOT be accessed from here.
        because robot may be driven by intelligent assistant, for example voice command.
        Parameters:

      • getScheduler

        public final Scheduler getScheduler(String domain)
        create or open exists project/session level job scheduler.

        if current thread is session level, then return a session level scheduler.
        if current thread is project level, then return a project level scheduler.
        for session level scheduler, same domain in difference session means difference scheduler.

        usage of schedule (JRuby) : 
         import Java::hc.server.util.calendar.WeeklyJobCalendar
 import java.lang.StringBuilder
 
 ctx = Java::hc.server.ui.ProjectContext::getProjectContext()
 scheduler = ctx.getScheduler("MyScheduler1")
 scheduler.start()
 
 if scheduler.isExistsTrigger("Trigger1") == false
   builder = StringBuilder.new(100)
   builder.append("ctx = Java::hc.server.ui.ProjectContext::getProjectContext()\n")
   builder.append("ctx.showTipOnTray(\"executing job1\")\n")
   scheduler.addJob("Job1", builder.toString())
 
   weeklyCalendar = WeeklyJobCalendar.new()
   weeklyCalendar.setDayExcluded(java.util.Calendar::SUNDAY, true)
   weeklyCalendar.setDayExcluded(java.util.Calendar::SATURDAY, true)
   scheduler.addCalendar("Calendar1", weeklyCalendar)
 
   scheduler.addCronTrigger("Trigger1", "0/30 * * * * ?", "Calendar1", "Job1")#trigger "Job1" when "Calendar1" every 30 seconds
   puts "Trigger1 next fire time : " + scheduler.getTriggerNextFireTime("Trigger1").toString()
 end
        Tip :
        session level scheduler will be shutdown by server after session is logout/lineoff.
        project level scheduler will be shutdown by server after shutdown project.

        one scheduler or multiple?
        1. please add multiple jobs, calendars and triggers in one scheduler,
        2. start, standby, clear, and shutdown a scheduler,
        3. to stop/clear some triggers, not others, then you should create multiple schedulers.

        current job scheduler is based on Quartz 2.2.3
        Parameters:
        domain - each domain is stored in different database.
        Returns:
        if a scheduler is shutdown and invoke this method with the same domain, then a new instance scheduler will be created, otherwise the same instance returned.
        Since:
        7.57
        See Also:
        getScheduler(String, boolean), getScheduler(String, boolean, boolean), backup()

      • getScheduler

        public final Scheduler getScheduler(String domain,
                                    boolean isAllInRAM)
        create or open exists project/session level job scheduler.

        if current thread is session level, then return a session level scheduler.
        if current thread is project level, then return a project level scheduler.
        for session level scheduler, same domain in difference session means difference scheduler.
        session level scheduler is all in RAM, even though pass isAllInRAM with false.

        Tip :
        session level scheduler will be shutdown by server after session is logout/lineoff.
        project level scheduler will be shutdown by server after shutdown project.
        Parameters:
        domain -
        isAllInRAM - true means all in RAM, false means stored in database.
        Returns:
        Since:
        7.57
        See Also:
        getScheduler(String), getScheduler(String, boolean, boolean)

      • getScheduler

        public final Scheduler getScheduler(String domain,
                                    boolean isAllInRAM,
                                    boolean isSessionScheduler)
        create or open exists project/session level job scheduler.

        for session level scheduler, same domain in difference session means difference scheduler.
        session level scheduler is all in RAM, even though pass isAllInRAM with false.

        Tip :
        session level scheduler will be shutdown by server after session is logout/lineoff.
        project level scheduler will be shutdown by server after shutdown project.
        Parameters:
        domain -
        isAllInRAM - true means all in RAM, false means stored in database.
        isSessionScheduler - true means create or get a session level scheduler.
        if current thread is project level, and isSessionScheduler is true, then return null.
        if current thread is session level, and isSessionScheduler is false, then return a project level.
        Returns:
        null means current thread is project level, but isSessionScheduler is true.
        See Also:
        getScheduler(String)

      • getSoftUID

        public final String getSoftUID()
        SoftUID is an identifier created when mobile application is installed on mobile.

        if mobile application is removed and install again on same mobile, the SoftID is changed.
        it is NOT ID from hardware.

        you can't invoke it before EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOGIN or after EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOGOUT.

      • goExternalURLWhenInSession

        public final void goExternalURLWhenInSession(String url)
        Warning : when in project level it will do nothing.

        open/go to external URL in client application.

        Important :
        socket/connect permissions is required even if the domain of external URL is the same with the domain of upgrade HAR project URL.

        More about back :
        1. there is always a float button for back. 2. onclick='javascript:window.hcserver.back();'
        3. history.back = function(){window.hcserver.back();};

        2. iOS 9 and above must use secure URLs.
        Parameters:

      • goExternalURLWhenInSession

        @Deprecated
public final void goExternalURLWhenInSession(String url,
                                                         boolean isUseExtBrowser)
        Deprecated. 
        Warning : when in project level it will do nothing.

        deprecated, replaced by goExternalURLWhenInSession(String).

        go to external URL in system web browser or client application.

        Important :
        socket/connect permissions is required even if the domain of external URL is the same with the domain of upgrade HAR project URL.

        Warning :
        1. the external URL may be sniffed when in moving (exclude HTTPS).
        2. iOS 9 and above must use secure URLs.
        3. In iOS (not Android), when go external URL and isUseExtBrowser is true, the application will be turn into background and released after seconds. In future, it maybe keep alive in background.
        Parameters:
        url -
        isUseExtBrowser - true : use system web browser to open URL; false : the URL will be opened in client application and still keep foreground.

      • goMletWhenInSession

      • goWhenInSession

        public final void goWhenInSession(String url)
        Jump mobile to following targets:
        1. Mlet.URL_SCREEN : enter the desktop screen of server from mobile,
        2. form://myMlet : open and show a form,
        3. controller://myctrl : open and show a controller,
        4. cmd://myCmd : run script commands only,

        Bring to top :
        1. jump to form://B from form://A,
        2. ready jump to form://A again from form://B.
        3. system will bring the target (form://A) to top if it is opened.

        Warning :
        in project level it will do nothing.

        Note :
        go to external URL (for example, http://homecenter.mobi), invoke goExternalURLWhenInSession(String).
        Parameters:
        url -
        Since:
        7.30
        See Also:
        isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel(), goWhenInSession(String, String), goMletWhenInSession(Mlet, String)

      • isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel

        public static final boolean isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()
        return true if current thread in session level; otherwise in project level.

        session level means current thread is serving for a mobile client session, NOT for project.
        a server can serve multiple sessions which login with same account at same time.

        most of scripts are for session level to response the user request, but some will start up before session and keep working after session is closed,
        for example the IoT, EVENT_SYS_PROJ_STARTUP and EVENT_SYS_PROJ_SHUTDOWN.
        some IoT threads maybe run as long as the project, and they are required to serve for all sessions.

        Tip :
        1. all objects based on session level will gone automatically after EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOGOUT, exclude run(Runnable) and runAndWait(Runnable).
        2. in session level, these following methods serve only for that session;
        3. in project level, they serve for all sessions. (in other word, one command for all sessions)

        the difference between session level and project level :
        methods of ProjectContext session level project level
        isMobileLineOn() return true, if current client keep connection return true, at least one client session keep connection
        isMobileInBackground() return true, if current client run in background return true, at least one client session is run in background
        isMobileOnRelay() return true, if current client is on relay server (not directly connect to server) return true, at least one client session is on relay
        sendMessage send an alert dialog to current mobile send the same alert to all client sessions
        sendMovingMsg send a message moving from right to left for current mobile send same message to all client sessions
        sendQuestion send a question to mobile to current mobile send same question to all client sessions
        sendNotification send notification to current mobile send notification to all client session
        sendAUSound send a AU sound data to current mobile send same AU sound to all client sessions
        playTone play tone on current mobile play tone on all client sessions
        vibrate vibrate on current mobile vibrate on all client sessions
        alertOn set alert on on current mobile set alert on on all client sessions
        alertOff set alert off on current mobile set alert off on all client sessions
        getMobileLocale() locale of current mobile the locale for all sessions or 'en-US' in project level
        getMobileWidth() mobile width of current session 0 if mobile not login or in project level
        getMobileHeight() mobile height of current session 0 if mobile not login or in project level
        getMobileOSVer() version of mobile OS of current session "0.0.1" if mobile not login or in project level
        getMobileOS() mobile OS of current session empty string if mobile not login or in project level
        getSoftUID() mobile Soft UID of current session empty string if mobile not login or in project level
        getMobileDPI() mobile DPI of current session -1 if mobile not login or in project level.

        the following scripts are executed in project level :
        • EVENT_SYS_PROJ_STARTUP
        • scripts in IoT, such as Robot, Converter, Device
        • the procedure of RobotListener.action(hc.server.msb.RobotEvent) if it is added in project level,
          if it is added in CtrlResponse or HTMLMlet, then the procedure is in session level
        • the new thread runs in project level if it is builded in project level
        • runnable runs in project level if run(Runnable) is in project level
        • runnable runs in project level if runAndWait(Runnable) is in project level
        • EVENT_SYS_PROJ_SHUTDOWN

        the following scripts are executed in session level :
        • EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOGIN
        • menu item scripts, for examples Command, Mlet/HTMLMlet and CtrlResponse
        • the procedure of SystemEventListener.onEvent(String) triggered by session events (NOT project event EVENT_SYS_PROJ_SHUTDOWN), even if it is added in project level
        • the procedure of RobotListener.action(hc.server.msb.RobotEvent) if the RobotListener is added in session level
        • the procedure of Robot.operate(long, Object) to execute command from user
        • the new thread runs in session level if it is builded in session level
        • runnable runs in session level if run(Runnable) is in session level
        • runnable runs in session level if runAndWait(Runnable) is in session level
        • EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOGOUT
        Returns:
        Since:
        7.20

      • isInstallingFromClient

        public final boolean isInstallingFromClient()
        for example HAR is installing from client, and it is required to input token for device connection, you can use Dialog for custom input, otherwise if is installing from PC desktop, you must use showInputDialog(String, String[], String[]).

      • matchLocale

        public static String matchLocale(String locale,
                                 Map map)
        find the best match locale from a map.

        the followings languages are treated as equivalents. (see Java Doc Locale)
        1. he and iw
        2. yi and ji
        3. id and in

        for example, locale is "zh-Hans-CN", the match process is following :
        1. if match "zh-Hans-CN", then ok,
        2. if fail, try match "zh-Hans",
        3. if fail, try match "zh-CN",
        4. if fail, try match "zh",
        5. if fail, try match "en-US",
        6. if fail, try match "en",
        7. if fail, return null;

        if locale is "he-IL", the match process is following :
        1. if match "he-IL", then ok,
        2. if fail, try match "iw-IL",
        3. if fail, try match "he",
        4. if fail, try match "iw",
        5. if fail, try match "en-US",
        6. if fail, try match "en",
        7. if fail, return null;
        Parameters:
        locale - case sensitive
        map -
        Returns:
        null if fail to match.
        Since:
        7.40
        See Also:
        getMobileLocale()

      • playTone

        public final void playTone(int note,
                           int duration,
                           int volume)
        play tone at mobile if in session level; or play tone to all client session if in project level.

        you should disable mute option on mobile first.
        Parameters:
        note - A note is given in the range of 0 to 127 inclusive. Defines the tone of the note as specified by the above formula.
        duration - The duration of the tone in milli-seconds. Duration must be positive.
        volume - Audio volume range from 0 to 100. 100 represents the maximum
        Since:
        6.98
        See Also:
        isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()

      • printAllThreadStack

        Since:

      • printAndReportStackTrace

        public static final void printAndReportStackTrace(Throwable throwable)
        print stack trace to logger and report it to project provider explicitly (not implicit).

        More about report exception :
        • enable option->developer->report exception is required.
        • if exception is caught by server, NOT by project, it will be reported to project provider implicitly.
        • if field Report exception URL / Email address of project is blank, then reporting is DISABLED and print stack trace only.
        • it is NOT required to apply for the permission of connection.
        • it reports stack trace on server, NOT for mobile.

        PHP code to receive exception:

        if ('POST' == $_SERVER['REQUEST_METHOD']){//POST to server
          $exception = json_decode(file_get_contents('php://input'), true);//JSON object is UTF-8
          //print_r($exception);//all fields are string even if tag_structureVersion.

          //echo $exception['tag_structureVersion'];
          //tag_structureVersion is used to check the structure version of description. if new field is added, it will be upgraded.
        }
        Parameters:
        throwable -
        Since:
        7.4

      • registerAssistant

        public final void registerAssistant(Assistant assistant)
        register/substitute a assistant, when a VoiceCommand is coming, it will be dispatched to Assistant.onVoice(VoiceCommand).

        it is not required to register assistant for project, if a voice command is too complex to process, maybe server will do it for you, but it will take a long time for the machine to learn.
        Parameters:
        assistant - null means deregister a assistant.
        Since:
        7.47

      • removeMenuItemFromSessionLevel

        public final MenuItem removeMenuItemFromSessionLevel(int position)
        remove position from list of session level.

        it is thread safe.

        the menu items added possibly by system (for example, add QR) are excluded.
        Parameters:
        position - the position of the item to be removed.
        Returns:
        element that was removed, or null if index out of bounds or current thread is in project level.
        Since:
        7.20
        See Also:
        getMenuItemsSizeOfSessionLevel(), isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()

      • removeProperty

        public final String removeProperty(String key)
        remove the property with the given name.
        Parameters:
        key - key whose property is to be removed
        Returns:
        the property to which the key had been mapped, or null if the key did not have a property
        See Also:
        getProperty(String), setProperty(String, String), clearProperty(String), saveProperties()

      • removeSystemEventListener

        public final boolean removeSystemEventListener(SystemEventListener listener)
        Removes the specified system event listener.

        the listener added in session level will gone automatically after EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOGOUT.
        Parameters:
        listener - If listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.
        Returns:
        true if the projectContext contained the specified listener
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        addSystemEventListener(SystemEventListener), isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()

      • run

        public final void run(Runnable runnable)
        start a Runnable task asynchronous in project thread pool or session thread pool depends on current thread is in project or session level.

        in session level, the runnable task should be finished after EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOGOUT.
        in project level, the runnable task should be finished after EVENT_SYS_PROJ_SHUTDOWN.

        Note :
        1. please put long time task and network operation in here.
        2. it is a good choice to put task in getScheduler(String), because it will be shutdown by server and release all resources.
        Parameters:
        runnable -
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        runAndWait(Runnable), runInProjectLevel(Runnable), addSystemEventListener(SystemEventListener), isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()

      • runAndWait

        public final void runAndWait(Runnable runnable)
        start a Runnable task and wait for done in project thread pool or session thread pool depends on current thread is in project or session level.

        in session level, the runnable task should be finished after EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOGOUT.
        in project level, the runnable task should be finished after EVENT_SYS_PROJ_SHUTDOWN.
        Parameters:
        runnable -
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        run(Runnable), runAndWaitInProjectLevel(Runnable), addSystemEventListener(SystemEventListener), isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()

      • runAndWaitInProjectLevel

        public final void runAndWaitInProjectLevel(Runnable runnable)
        the runnable will be executed in project level, no matter current thread is in session or project level.
        Parameters:
        runnable -
        Since:
        7.20
        See Also:
        runAndWait(Runnable), isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()

      • runInProjectLevel

        public final void runInProjectLevel(Runnable runnable)
        this method is useful when current thread is in session level,
        and the runnable should be executed in project level.

        Note :
        1. please put long time task and network operation in here,
        2. it is a good choice to put task in getScheduler(String), because it will be shutdown by server and release all resources.
        3. there is NOT API for task to be executed in session level when in project level thread. Maybe you need sendDialogByBuilding(Runnable).
        Parameters:
        runnable -
        Since:
        7.20
        See Also:
        run(Runnable), isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()

      • saveProperties

        public final void saveProperties()
        save properties to persistent system.

        Important :
        1. data of properties will be deleted if current project is removed.
        2. it is a good practice to save small data in properties system and save big data in local disk / cloud system.
        3. if you want to create file on local disk, please use getPrivateFile(String) to get instance of File.
        4. to create and open database, please invoke getDBConnection(String, String, String).
        5. if this server runs on Android Marshmallow or later, Android will 'Auto Backup for Apps'.
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        setProperty(String, String), getProperty(String), removeProperty(String), backup()

      • sendDialogAndWaitByBuilding

        public final boolean sendDialogAndWaitByBuilding(Runnable runnable)
        see sendDialogByBuilding(Runnable) for more.

        About return status :
        1. in project level, return true means dialog is dismissed/canceled by one client, false means all sessions are line off.
        2. in session level, return true means dialog is dismissed by client, false means canceled by client, when line off the execution will be terminated.
        Parameters:
        runnable -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        isClientLineOn()

        About return status :
        1. in session level, return true means dialog is dismissed by client, false means canceled by client, when line off the execution will be terminated.
        2. in project level, return false;
        Parameters:
        dialog -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        isClientLineOn()

      • sendDialogByBuilding

        public final void sendDialogByBuilding(Runnable runnable)
        send a dialog to mobile if in session level, or send same dialog(s) to all client sessions if in project level.

        in project level, if one session replies, then the same dialog(s) in other sessions will be dismissed.

        code sample,

        in JRuby :
        ctx.sendDialogByBuilding {
          MyDefDialog.new()  #important : return is NOT allowed.
        }
        in Java :
        ctx.sendDialogByBuilding(new Runnable() {
          public void run() {
            new MyDefDialog();
          }
        });
        Why the parameter is Runnable to build instance from defined JRuby class or a Java class?
        because the layout of dialog is depends on the client screen size of that session.
        for example, there are three sessions, the runnable will be executed three times,
        and three instances of Dialog are builded for each session.

        if there is a alert message, question or other dialog is presented on client and NOT closed, the dialog will be delayed.

        this method is asynchronous, server will NOT wait for the result of dialog to the caller.

        Note : if mobile is in background (isMobileInBackground()), a notification is also created for mobile.
        Parameters:
        runnable - the Runnable to build instance from a defined JRuby class or a Java class.
        Since:
        7.30
        See Also:
        sendDialogAndWaitByBuilding(Runnable), sendDialogWhenInSession(Dialog), isClientLineOn()

      • sendDialogWhenInSession

        public final void sendDialogWhenInSession(Dialog dialog)
        Warning : when in project level it will do nothing.

        send a Dialog to client.

        if there is a alert message, question or other dialog is presented on client and NOT be closed, the dialog will be delayed.

        this method is asynchronous. system will NOT wait for the result of dialog to the caller.

        Note : if mobile is in background (isMobileInBackground()), a notification is also created for mobile.

        Parameters:
        dialog -
        Since:
        7.30
        See Also:
        sendDialogAndWaitWhenInSession(Dialog), sendDialogByBuilding(Runnable), showInputDialog(String, String[], String[]), isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()

      • sendMessage

        public final void sendMessage(String caption,
                              String text,
                              int type)
        it is equals with sendMessage(String, String, int, BufferedImage, int).

        in session level, send a alert message to mobile.
        in project level, send the same alert to all client sessions.

        Note : if mobile is in background (isMobileInBackground()), a notification is also created for mobile.

        if mobile option [Message, Notification to Speech also] is on, it may be spoken.
        the speech or not is depends on text, TTS engine, locale and mute of mobile.
        Parameters:
        caption - the caption of message.
        text - the body of message, "\n" for new line.
        type - one of MESSAGE_ERROR, MESSAGE_WARN, MESSAGE_INFO, MESSAGE_ALARM, MESSAGE_CONFIRMATION.
        See Also:
        sendMessage(String, String, int, BufferedImage, int)

      • sendMessage

        public final boolean sendMessage(String caption,
                                 String text,
                                 int type,
                                 BufferedImage image,
                                 int timeOut)
        send an alert message to current mobile if in session level, or send the same alert to all client sessions if in project level.

        if there is an other alert message, question or a Dialog is presented on client and NOT be closed, the alert message will be delayed.

        Note : if mobile is in background (isMobileInBackground()), a notification is also created for mobile.

        if mobile option [Message, Notification to Speech also] is on, it may be spoken.
        the speech or not is depends on text, TTS engine, locale and mute of mobile.
        Parameters:
        caption - the caption of message.
        text - the body of message, "\n" for new line.
        type - one of MESSAGE_ERROR, MESSAGE_WARN, MESSAGE_INFO, MESSAGE_ALARM, MESSAGE_CONFIRMATION.
        image - null if no image, it should be small image, please not big image.
        timeOut - 0:forever;a positive time value in milliseconds
        Since:
        6.98
        See Also:
        sendMessage(String, String, int), isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()

      • sendMovingMsg

        public final void sendMovingMsg(String msg)
        send a message moving from right to left for current mobile if in session level, or send same message to all client sessions if in project level.

        Note : if mobile is in background (isMobileInBackground()), a notification is also created for mobile.

        if mobile option [Message, Notification to Speech also] is on, it may be spoken.
        the speech or not is depends on text, TTS engine, locale and mute of mobile.

        if the message is too long, sendVoice(String) is a good choice.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to show.
        Since:
        6.98
        See Also:
        sendMessage(String, String, int, BufferedImage, int), isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()

      • sendNotification

        public final void sendNotification(String title,
                                   String text,
                                   int flags)
        send notification to current mobile if in session level, or send notification to all client session if in project level.

        if mobile option [Message, Notification to Speech also] is on, it may be spoken.
        the speech or not is depends on text, TTS engine, locale and mute of mobile.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of notification.
        text - the body of notification.
        flags - one of the following or combination, or none.
        FLAG_NOTIFICATION_SOUND : notification with sound. If mute option of mobile is enabled, then no sound;
        FLAG_NOTIFICATION_VIBRATE : notification with vibrate
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()

      • sendQuestion

        public final void sendQuestion(String caption,
                               String text,
                               BufferedImage image,
                               Runnable yesRunnable,
                               Runnable noRunnable,
                               Runnable cancelRunnable)
        send a question to mobile if in session level, or send same question to all client sessions if in project level.
        in project level, if one session replies, then the same question in other sessions will be dismissed.

        if there is an alert message, other question or a Dialog is presented on client and NOT be closed, the question will be delayed.

        this method is asynchronous. system will NOT wait for the result of question to the caller.
        for synchronous, please use sendQuestionAndWait(String, String, BufferedImage, Runnable, Runnable, Runnable).

        Important : the yesRunnable, noRunnable, cancelRunnable will be executed in session level, no matter current thread is project or session level.

        Note : if mobile is in background (isMobileInBackground()), a notification is also created for mobile.

        if mobile option [Message, Notification to Speech also] is on, it may be spoken.
        the speech or not is depends on text, TTS engine, locale and mute of mobile.
        Parameters:
        caption - the caption of the question.
        text - the content of the question.
        image - a image to describe the question. Null for no image.
        yesRunnable - the runnable will be executed if choosing 'YES'. Null for doing nothing.
        noRunnable - the runnable will be executed if choosing 'NO'. Null for doing nothing.
        cancelRunnable - the runnable will be executed if choosing 'CANCEL'. It will not be executed when line off. Set null to not display cancel button in question, but it is still cancelable. To set question to be not cancelable, use sendQuestionNotCancelable(String, String, BufferedImage, Runnable, Runnable).
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        sendQuestionAndWait(String, String, BufferedImage, Runnable, Runnable, Runnable), sendQuestionNotCancelable(String, String, BufferedImage, Runnable, Runnable), isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel(), isClientLineOn()

      • sendQuestionAndWait

        public final boolean sendQuestionAndWait(String caption,
                                         String text,
                                         BufferedImage image,
                                         Runnable yesRunnable,
                                         Runnable noRunnable,
                                         Runnable cancelRunnable)
        for more, see sendQuestion(String, String, BufferedImage, Runnable, Runnable, Runnable)

        About return status :
        1. in project level, return true means question is processed/canceled by one client, false means all sessions are line off.
        2. in session level, return true means question is processed by client, false means canceled by client, when line off the execution will be terminated.
        Parameters:
        caption -
        text -
        image -
        yesRunnable -
        noRunnable -
        cancelRunnable -
        See Also:
        isClientLineOn()

                                                      Runnable noRunnable)

        1. in project level, return true means question is processed by one client, false means all sessions are line off.
        2. in session level, return true means question is processed by client, when line off the execution will be terminated.

      • sendQuestionNotCancelable

        public final void sendQuestionNotCancelable(String caption,
                                            String text,
                                            BufferedImage image,
                                            Runnable yesRunnable,
                                            Runnable noRunnable)
        send a not cancelable question to mobile if in session level, or send same question to all client sessions if in project level.

        a cancelable question can be canceled, for example pressing back key in Android.
        Parameters:
        caption - the caption of the question.
        text - the content of the question.
        image - a image to describe the question. Null for no image.
        yesRunnable - the runnable will be executed if choosing 'YES'. Null for doing nothing.
        noRunnable - the runnable will be executed if choosing 'NO'. Null for doing nothing.
        See Also:
        sendQuestionAndWaitNotCancelable(String, String, BufferedImage, Runnable, Runnable), sendQuestion(String, String, BufferedImage, Runnable, Runnable, Runnable)

      • sendVoice

        public final void sendVoice(String voice)
        send a voice to client/mobile if in session level, or send same voice to all client sessions if in project level.

        if you want show this voice as a moving message and speech again, please use sendMovingMsg(String).

        if meet one of following, the voice is traded as a moving message on client/mobile.
        1. TTS is not available in client/mobile,
        2. the language of TTS supported is not the locale of client/mobile,
        3. client/mobile is mute,
        Parameters:
        voice -
        Since:
        7.63
        See Also:
        isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()

      • setAttribute

        public final Object setAttribute(String name,
                                 Object obj)
        set an object to a given attribute name.

        to set an attribute for session, please see getClientSession().

        Note : you can't save attribute to persistent system, but you can save properties of current project to persistent system.

        it is thread safe.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of attribute.
        obj - the value of the attribute.
        Returns:
        the previous value of the specified name, or null if it did not have one
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        removeAttribute(String), clearAttribute(String), getAttribute(String), getAttributeNames()

      • setLocationUpdates

        public final void setLocationUpdates(long milliseconds)
        set GPS/WiFi location update interval time.
        it is a suggested value.

        if minTimes is upper than the default, then do nothing.
        if minTimes is lower than other project, then new minTimes applies to all projects.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - minimum time interval between location updates, in milliseconds
        See Also:
        EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOCATION, ClientSession.getLocationLongitude()

      • showInputDialog

        public static final String[] showInputDialog(String title,
                                             String[] fieldNames,
                                             String[] fieldDescs)
        show a dialog for input on this server, NOT on client.
        if user is installing (scan QR code) current project from client, then the dialog is shown on client.

        you can also send custom Dialog when is installing HAR from client, see isInstallingFromClient().

        this method is mainly used in the following scenarios :
        for example, in order to connect device, user may be required to input token of devices.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of input dialog
        fieldNames - the name of each field.
        fieldDescs - the description of the each field. The HTML tags, such as <STRONG> and <BR>, are supported.
        Returns:
        the input values of each fields.
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        sendDialogWhenInSession(Dialog)

      • showMessageDialog

        public static final void showMessageDialog(String message)
        pop up an information message dialog on this server, NOT on client.

        if the message is displaying and not closed, then it will NOT be showed twice at same time.

        Important :
        the current thread will NOT be blocked.
        Parameters:
        message - the body of message.
        Since:
        7.0

      • showMessageDialog

                                           String title,

        the current thread will NOT be blocked.

        title - the title of message.
        messageType - one of the following :
        JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE,
        JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE,
        JOptionPane.WARNING_MESSAGE,
        JOptionPane.QUESTION_MESSAGE,
        JOptionPane.PLAIN_MESSAGE
